text:
This can be done using css absolute positioning.

The section wrapper would be "position: relative" and then the two objects would be "position: absolute;" with top and side positioning.

The absolute objects will be positioned to the closet relative parent element.

The text might then end up behind the absolute objects but can be brought to the top by also making it relative or using another css attribute called z-index.

It can be a lot to take in at first, this might be helpful:
<https://css-tricks.com/almanac/properties/p/position/>
Looks like they fixed it - no issues for me today
thank you so much! This is a nice help
<@UQWGKUEN7> I’m curious if you’ve gotten this to work before. I tried it out and even though it says an initial upload occurred, it doesn’t remove files that are no longer in my local file system.
It’s only additive, so it’ll do the initial upload and just add any new files, but won’t remove deleted ones
